title: Daniel James learning from Eden Hazard as he bids to improve his game at Man Utd
text:

Daniel James has told how he is learning from Eden Hazard in a bid to improve at Man Utd.

The Welsh winger has enjoyed a flying start to life at United since his £15m summer arrival - scoring three times in seven Premier League appearances.

But as James stepped foot in the top flight, Hazard moved on to Real Madrid after seven spectacular years in England with Chelsea.

Now the United star is hoping to channel Hazard's talents into his own game as he looks to make a real impact at Old Trafford.

James told the BBC : "The way Hazard was at Chelsea - his movement in behind, when to go and when to stay - he's so quick, but the way he stops people and goes, and little one-twos, getting shots off quickly is something he's done his whole career.

(Image: Getty Images)

"Getting in the box for tap-ins is something I need to improve on. When Hazard does a one-two you can't get anywhere near him.

"When I was younger, people said to me you won't always be able to rely on speed. I used to just kick it past players and run - but nowadays that won't happen, especially when people bank up on me."

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

James has already impressed with his performances for the Red Devils, with the 21-year-old already drawing praise from club legends Gary Neville, Patrice Evra and his international boss Ryan Giggs.

He followed up his decent league form with a goal for Wales in the recent international break.

Giggs said when James joined up with the squad last month: "When you score, it gives you a lift. It doesn’t matter who you are in the world or what kind of ability you have. Confidence is everything and it builds.

(Image: Manchester United via Getty Imag)

"We all know what he’s capable of, what he’s done, especially over the last eight or nine months, he just keeps getting better and better."

James was started in the more unfamiliar position of centre-forward for United's recent draw with AZ Alkmaar, but is likely to return to the wing for the trip to Newcastle on Sunday.

United are currently 11th in the table, but a win could see them leapfrog their way into sixth, with top four rivals Arsenal also in action against Bournemouth .

(Image: REUTERS)

Hazard meanwhile got his Madrid career up and running with his first goal for the club in their 4-2 win over Granada on Saturday.

Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane said: "We need to see Eden like this, playing well and scoring goals.

"He wanted that, he was happy in the dressing room. We hope it’s the first of many for him."
description: The 21-year-old begun his Premier League career this season after the curtain had closed on Hazard's time in England
